headline: Royal Caribbean Group announces completion of $1.5 billion offering of senior unsecured notes
summary: Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd. (NYSE: RCL) (the "Company") today announced that it has completed its registered public offering of $1.5 billion aggregate principal amount of 5.375% senior unsecured notes due 2036 (the "Notes"). The Notes will mature on January 15, 2036, unless earlier redeemed or repurchased.

content.title: Royal Caribbean Group announces completion of $1.5 billion offering of senior unsecured notes

(NYSE: RCL) (the "Company") today announced that it has completed its registered public offering of $1.5 billion aggregate principal amount of 5.375% senior unsecured notes due 2036 (the "Notes"). The Notes will mature on January 15, 2036, unless earlier redeemed or repurchased.

headline: Royal Caribbean Group Launches 'Port Partners' in Seward, Alaska with Inaugural Small Business Accelerator Program
summary: Royal Caribbean Group (NYSE: RCL), a global vacation leader that is redefining the future of vacations, has launched an inaugural business accelerator program in the coastal community of Seward, Alaska, unveiling its first initiative in its 'Port Partners' program. Aimed at empowering aspiring entrepreneurs, the robust project entails a 10-week academic course, personalized mentorship and coaching, and an interactive pitch competition culminating in a $20,000 grant awarded to one standout partic

content.title: Royal Caribbean Group Launches 'Port Partners' in Seward, Alaska with Inaugural Small Business Accelerator Program
content.summary: Royal Caribbean Group (NYSE: RCL), a global vacation leader that is redefining the future of vacations, has launched an inaugural business accelerator program in the coastal community of Seward, Alaska, unveiling its first initiative in its 'Port Partners' program. Aimed at empowering aspiring entrepreneurs, the robust project entails a 10-week academic course, personalized mentorship and coaching, and an interactive pitch competition culminating in a $20,000 grant awarded to one standout partic

thumbnail.caption: Preston Carnahan, Vice President, Destination Development, Royal Caribbean Group; Tom Tougas, Seward Gateway Hotel; KellyAnne Cavaretta, Seward Small Business Advisor, Alaska SBDC Kenai Peninsula Center, Dr. Cory Ortiz, Director, Alaska Vocational Technical Center; Dr. Carlee Simon, Interim Dean, School of Career Education, University of Alaska Southeast; Oriana Branon, Associate Vice President, Corporate Communications, Royal Caribbean Group; Amanda Sweeting, Executive Director, Seward Chamber of Commerce; Kat Sorensen, Seward City Manager.
